meanings.definition: A select group that is superior in terms of ability or qualities.
meanings.sent1: The elite students were chosen to represent the school in the competition.
meanings.sent2: The elite athletes trained hard to win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The elite chess players were so good, they could play blindfolded!
meanings.sent4: She was part of the elite group of scientists pushing the boundaries of knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The elite team of doctors worked tirelessly to save lives.

meanings.definition: A group of people considered to be the best in a particular society or category.
meanings.sent1: The elite of the fashion world attended the exclusive event.
meanings.sent2: The elite of the art community gathered for the gallery opening.
meanings.sent3: The elite members of the book club had read every classic novel.
meanings.sent4: She felt like part of the elite when she received the prestigious award.
meanings.sent5: The elite group of chefs prepared a feast fit for royalty.
